description.value: This profile sets minimum expectations for a Composition resource in the context of a patient summary in an Australian context. It is based on [AU Base Composition](http://hl7.org.au/fhir/StructureDefinition/au-composition) and imposes [Composition (IPS)](http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/ips/StructureDefinition/Composition-uv-ips). AU Patient Summary (AU PS) is specified in this guide as a HL7 FHIR document (a Bundle including a Composition), composed by a set of potentially reusable 'minimal' data blocks (the AU PS profiles).

definition.value: AU Patient Summary Composition. A composition is a set of healthcare-related information that is assembled together into a single logical document that provides a single coherent statement of meaning, establishes its own context and that has clinical attestation with regard to who is making the statement. While a Composition defines the structure, it does not actually contain the content: rather the full content of a document is contained in a Bundle, of which the Composition is the first resource contained.

short.value: Conformance claim to a specific Patient Summary specification

definition.value: The conformance of this Composition to a specific version of a Patient Summary specification (e.g. AU PS 1.0.0 conformance claim http://hl7.org.au/fhir/ps/StructureDefinition/au-ps-composition|1.0.0, IPS 2.0.0 conformance claim http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/ips/StructureDefinition/Composition-uv-ips|2.0.0)
Specifies that this composition refers to a Patient Summary (Loinc "60591-5")

Who or what the composition is about. In general a composition can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (e.g. a machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of livestock, or a set of patients that share a common exposure). For the AU PS the subject is always the patient.

short.value: Who and/or what authored the patient summary

definition.value:
Identifies who is responsible for the information in the patient summary, not necessarily who typed it in.
The type of author(s) contribute to determine the "nature"of the patient summary: e.g. a "human-curated" Vs. "automatically generated".

Official human-readable label for the composition.
For this document the title would likely include the text "Patient Summary" or any equivalent translation and other relevant document information.

The main activity being described by a patient summary is the provision of healthcare over a period of time. In the CDA representation of the IPS this is shown by setting the value of serviceEvent/@classCode to “PCPR” (care provision) and indicating the duration over which care was provided in serviceEvent/effectiveTime. In the FHIR representation at least one event will be used to record this information. Additional data from outside this duration can also be included if it is relevant to care provided during that time range (e.g., reviewed during the stated time range). For example if the patient summary is generated by a GP, based on information recorded in his/her EHR-S, then the start value will represent the date when the treatment relationship between the patient and the GP started; and the end value the date of the latest care event.
The provision of healthcare over a period of time this patient summary is documenting.
The root of the sections that make up the patient summary composition.

short.value: Additional notes that apply to the section (but not to specific resource)

definition.value: Additional notes that apply to the section (but not to specific resource).
Information about a patient's clinical problems or conditions that are currently being monitored.

human.value: Either section.entry or emptyReason are present

short.value: Clinical problems or conditions currently being monitored for the patient

definition.value: The clinical problems or conditions currently being monitored for the patient. An entry can be used to document that no information about problems is available, or that no relevant problems are known.

short.value: Patient Summary Allergies and Intolerances Section

definition.value: Information about a patient's relevant allergies or intolerances, describing the kind of reaction (e.g. rash, anaphylaxis, etc.); preferably the agents that cause it; and optionally the criticality and the certainty of the allergy. At a minimum, this section will list currently active and any relevant historical allergies and adverse reactions. If no information about allergies is available, or if no allergies are known this is to be clearly documented in this section.

human.value: Either section.entry or emptyReason are present

short.value: Relevant allergies or intolerances (conditions) for that patient

definition.value: The relevant allergies or intolerances (conditions) for that patient, describing the kind of reaction (e.g. rash, anaphylaxis, etc.); preferably the agents that cause it; and optionally the criticality and the certainty of the allergy. At a minimum, will include currently active and any relevant historical allergies and adverse reactions. An entry can be used to document that no information about allergies is available, or that no allergies are known.

Information about a patient's medications relevant for the scope of the patient summary. The actual content could depend on the jurisdiction, it could report: - the currently active medications; - the current and past medications considered relevant by the authoring GP; - the patient prescriptions or dispensations automatically extracted by a regional or a national EHR. In those cases medications are documented in the Patient Summary as medication statements or medication requests. This section requires either an entry indicating the subject is known not to be on any relevant medication; either an entry indicating that no information is available about medications; or entries summarising the subject's relevant medications.

human.value: Either section.entry or emptyReason are present

short.value: Medications relevant for the scope of the patient summary

definition.value: The medications relevant for the scope of the patient summary, or an indication that the subject is known not to be on any relevant medication; either that no information is available about medications.

Information about a patient's current immunisation status and pertinent immunisation history. The primary use case for this section is to enable communication of a patient's immunisation status. It could contain the entire immunisation history that is relevant to the period of time being summarised. This entry is used to document that no information about immunisations is available, or that no immunisations are known.

short.value: Patient's immunisation status and pertinent history

definition.value: The patient's current immunisation status and pertinent immunisation history. The primary use case is to enable communication of a patient's immunisation status. It can contain the entire immunisation history relevant to the period of time being summarised. An entry can be used to document that no information about immunisations is available, or that no immunisations are known.

Information about a patient's relevant observation results collected on the patient or produced on in-vitro biologic specimens collected from the patient. Some of these results could be laboratory results, others could be anatomic pathology results, others could be radiology results, and others could be clinical results.

short.value: Relevant observation results collected on the patient or produced on in-vitro biologic specimens collected from the patient

definition.value: The relevant observation results collected on the patient or produced on in-vitro biologic specimens collected from the patient. Some results could be laboratory results, others could be anatomic pathology results, others could be radiology results, and others could be clinical results.

short.value: Patient Summary History of Procedures Section

definition.value: Information about a patient's past procedures that are pertinent to the scope of this patient summary. Procedures could refer, for example to: 1. Invasive Diagnostic procedure: e.g. Cardiac catheterization; (the results of these procedure are documented in the results section) 2. Therapeutic procedure: e.g. dialysis; 3. Surgical procedure: e.g. appendectomy

short.value: Patient past procedures pertinent to the scope of this patient summary

definition.value: The patient's past procedures that are pertinent to the scope of this patient summary. Procedures can refer for example to: 1. Invasive Diagnostic procedure: e.g. Cardiac catheterization; (the results of these procedure are documented in the results section) 2. Therapeutic procedure: e.g. dialysis; 3. Surgical procedure: e.g. appendectomy. An entry can be used to document that no information about past procedures is available, or that no relevant past procedures are known.
Information about a patient's history of medical device use.

short.value: Patient history of medical device use

definition.value: The patient's history of medical device use. An entry can be used to document that no information about medical device use is available, or that no relevant medical device use is known.
Information about a patient's advance directives.
The patient's advance directive.
Information about a patient's alerts pertinent to the scope of the patient summary including flagging potential concerns and/or dangers to/from the patient and can also include obstacles to care.
The alert information to be communicated; can optionally reference other resources in the patient summary.

Information about a patient's functional status including a description of capability of the patient to perform acts of daily living, including possible needs of the patient to be continuously assessed by third parties. The invalidity status can in fact influence decisions about how to administer treatments. Profiles to express disabilities and functional assessments will be specified by future versions of this guide.

The patient's capability to perform acts of daily living, including possible needs of the patient to be continuously assessed by third parties. The invalidity status can in fact influence decisions about how to administer treatments. Profiles to express disabilities and functional assessments are expected be specified by future versions of this guide.

short.value: Patient Summary History of Past Illness Section

definition.value: Information about a patient's conditions that were suffered in the past and are no longer tracked in the Problem List.

short.value: Conditions the patient suffered in the past

definition.value: The conditions the patient suffered in the past and are no longer tracked in the Problem List.

short.value: Patient Summary History of Pregnancy Section

definition.value: Information about whether a patient is currently pregnant or not and can contain addition summarising information about the outcome of earlier pregnancies.

short.value: Current pregnancy status and, optionally, information about the outcome of earlier pregnancies

definition.value: Information about whether the patient is currently pregnant or not. It can contain addition summarising information about the outcome of earlier pregnancies.

Information about what matters to a patient. This can include needs, strengths, values, concerns and preferences to others providing support and care. The patient's story, provided here, can be told by the patient or by a proxy.
The information about what matters to a patient. This can include needs, strengths, values, concerns and preferences to others providing support and care.

short.value: Patient Summary Plan of Care Section

definition.value: Information about a patient's plans of care containing the expectations for care including proposals, goals, and order requests for monitoring, tracking, or improving the condition of the patient.

The dynamic, personalised care plans including identified needed healthcare activity, health objectives and healthcare goals, relating to one or more specified health issues in a healthcare process [Source EN ISO 13940]
Information about a patient's health related "lifestyle factors" or "lifestyle observations" (e.g. smoke habits, alcohol consumption, diets, risky habits.)
The patient's health related "lifestyle factors" or "lifestyle observations" (e.g. smoke habits, alcohol consumption, diets, risky habits.)

Information about a patient's vital signs including blood pressure, body temperature, heart rate, and respiratory rate. It can also include other clinical findings, such as height, weight, body mass index, head circumference, and pulse oximetry. In particular, notable vital signs or physical findings such as the most recent, maximum and/or minimum, baseline, or relevant trends can be included

short.value: Notable vital signs or physical findings

definition.value: The notable vital signs or physical findings as: blood pressure, body temperature, heart rate, and respiratory rate. It can also include other clinical findings, such as height, weight, body mass index, head circumference, and pulse oximetry. In particular, notable vital signs or physical findings such as the most recent, maximum and/or minimum, baseline, or relevant trends can be included
